page.title: 09Crampmoor Farm - a visit
page.content: {Crampmoor Farm, Crampmoor Lane, Romsey Our visit to Crampmoor Farm took place on Monday 17th. June, 1985. The farm is mainly a dairy farm though the owner(Mr. Lawes) is now starting to breed fish. The farm looks small. Behind the house is the milking parlour. Four cows can be milked at once and whilst being milked they eat cownuts which are full of protein.They are milked by machine and the milk is stored in a large cooling tank which holds 502 litres. The milk is sent to Unigate to be bottled and sold. The farm has 37 cows and thousands of fish. The herd are Jersey and Guernsey cows. The farm has 35.6 hectres(88 acres) of land. A vast area that was useless was turned into ponds for breeding fish. Mr. Lawes runs the farm singlehanded because he cannot afford help.
